statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Baylor 100, Wayland Baptist 72
article.story: WACO, Texas (AP) -- Curtis Jerrells scored 18 points and Kevin Rogers had 17 as Baylor beat Wayland Baptist 100-72 Saturday night. LaceDarius Dunn added 14 points and Henry Dugat scored 12 for the Bears (8-1). Michal Polanowski scored 16 points, Jason Griffin added 15 and Tony Jones and Kris Hatley had 11 each for Wayland Baptist, an NAIA school. The Pioneers (4-6) were still close in the second half after a three-point play by Polanowski pulled them within 58-50 with 13:38 left. The Bears then went on a 23-2 run spurred by a pair of layups by Josh Lomers, consecutive 3-pointers from Jerrells and Dugat and five Wayland turnovers. The Bears also made eight consecutive free throws over a 1:03 span to take an 81-52 lead with 7:33 remaining. Griffin hit two 3-pointers early and scored eight of the Pioneers' first 12 points as Wayland Baptist took a 12-5 lead with 14:30 left in the first half. Dunn answered with a 3-pointer, two free throws and a three-point play to spur a Bears rally that tied the score at 20-20 with 8:21 to play. The Bears made 14 of 27 from 3-point range, with Dunn and Jerrells hitting six each. Rogers also made the first 3-pointer of his career. All 11 Bears who played scored.
